Unit Master is a comprehensive front-to-back financial operations and capital markets platform designed for asset managers, private managers, and investment institutions. It manages portfolios, positions, accounts, orders, NAVs, transactions, payouts, reconciliation, performance, risk, and reporting all within a flexible, modular, and scalable system. Built for high stability, fast performance, and seamless integration, Unit Master supports both standalone and real-time operations, providing a powerful, modern solution that streamlines the entire investment and operations lifecycle.

Overview

Unit Master centralises all key investment operations in one platform. It coordinates client accounts, portfolios, and records so that teams can see the full picture at a glance. Dashboards and summaries give management a quick view of fund performance, client activity, and operational trends.

Transactions

The Transactions section is where all money movements are handled. Here you can make withdrawals, switch between your different accounts, and transfer funds from one account to another. It gives you a clear view of how money is coming in and going out of your accounts.

Reports

The Reports section provides a summary of key information about clients and agents. It brings together important data in one place so that you can quickly review client activity, agent performance, and other high level trends that support monitoring and decision making.

Statements

The Statements section gives you a detailed record of account activity over a selected period. It shows the amounts deposited, the funds invested, and the interest earned. This helps clients track how their money is growing and verify all movements on their accounts.

Finance

The Finance section explains how fund expenses are managed and applied. Fund expenses are accrued on a daily basis and deducted from the daily fund value, so that the unit price reflects the true cost of managing the fund. Withdrawals from the fund are then processed on a monthly basis, allowing clients to access their money in an organised way.

Security

The Security section is where clients can see how and where their money is invested. It lists the different investment options or instruments in which funds are placed and allows clients to review each holding. This helps clients understand how their investments are allocated and how each security is performing.
